intro: Aldama trichophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. Its showy, yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. The tree is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
